## 판결문 요약


384 U.S. 641 (1966)
KATZENBACH, ATTORNEY GENERAL, ET AL.
v.
MORGAN ET UX.
No. 847.
Supreme Court of United States.
Argued April 18, 1966.
Decided June 13, 1966.[*]
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
*642 Solicitor General Marshall argued the cause for appellants in No. 847. With him on the brief were Assistant Attorney General Doar, Ralph S. Spritzer, Louis F. Claiborne, St. John Barrett and Louis M. Kauder.
J. Lee Rankin argued the cause for appellant in No. 877. With him on the brief were Norman Redlich and Seymour B. Quel.
Alfred Avins argued the cause and filed a brief for appellees in both cases.
Rafael Hernandez Colon, Attorney General, argued the cause and filed a brief for the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, as amicus curiae, urging reversal.
Jean M. Coon, Assistant Attorney General, argued the cause for the State of New York, as amicus curiae, urging affirmance. With her on the brief were Louis J. Lefkowitz, *643 Attorney General, and Ruth Kessler Toch, Acting Solicitor General.
MR. JUSTICE BRENNAN delivered the opinion of the Court.
